Now, code structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    // First part: read N and list, compute a
    int N;
    scanf("%d", &N);
    int list[N];
    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &list[i]);
    }
    
    int a =1;
    int pos =0;
    for (int i=1; i<N; i++) {
        if (list[i] < list[pos]) {
            a++;
            pos =i;
        }
    }
    
    // Second part: process a into total
    char s[20];
    sprintf(s, "%d", a);
    int len_s = strlen(s);
    
    // Process s into t
    char t[len_s +1];
    int t_len =0;
    int i=0;
    while (i < len_s) {
        char c = s[i];
        if (c == 'A') {
            t[t_len++] = 'A';
            i++;
        } else if (c == 'B') {
            if (i < len_s -1 && s[i+1] == 'C') {
                t[t_len++] = 'D';
                i +=2;
            } else {
                t[t_len++] = 'X';
                i++;
            }
        } else {
            t[t_len++] = 'X';
            i++;
        }
    }
    t[t_len] = '\0';
    
    // Compute total
    int total =0;
    int numA =0;
    for (int j=0; j < t_len; j++) {
        char c = t[j];
        if (c == 'X') {
            numA =0;
        } else {
            if (c == 'A') {
                numA++;
            } else { // 'D'
                total += numA;
            }
        }
    }
    
    // Third part: compute count of 753 numbers up to total
    int N_third = total;
    if (N_third <0) N_third =0; // in case total is negative? Probably not, but just in case.
    
    int count =0;
    int queue[20000];
    int front =0, rear =0;
    
    // Initialize with 7,5,3
    for (int d=0; d<3; d++) {
        int num = (d==0)?7 : (d==1?5:3);
        if (num <= N_third) {
            count++;
            queue[rear++] = num;
        }
    }
    
    while (front < rear) {
        int current = queue[front++];
        for (int d=0; d<3; d++) {
            int next_num = current *10 + (d==0?7 : (d==1?5:3));
            if (next_num <= N_third) {
                count++;
                queue[rear++] = next_num;
            }
        }
    }
    
    printf("%d\n", count);
    
    return 0;
}
